description: A Connell-like sequence: take the first multiple of 1, the next 2 multiples of 2, the next 3 multiples of 3, etc.
links: Gary E. Stevens, A Connell-Like Sequence, J. Integer Sequences, 1 (1998), #98.1.4.
mathematica: Flatten[ Table[ n*(Floor[ (n-1)^2/3] + k), {n, 1, 12}, {k, 1, n}]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Sep 30 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a033291 n k = a033291_tabl !! (n-1) !! (k-1)a033291_row n = a033291_tabl !! (n-1)a033291_tabl = f 1 [1..] where   f k xs = ys : f (k+1) (dropWhile (<= last ys) xs) where     ys  = take k $ filter ((== 0) . (`mod` k)) xsa192735 n = head $ a033291_tabl !! (n-1)a192736 n = last $ a033291_tabl !! (n-1)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 18 2012, Jul 08 2011(PARI) a(n)=my(q=(sqrtint(8*n-7)+1)\2); q*n-q*(q+1)\6*q \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jan 06 2016
author: _Gary E. Stevens_
extensions: Corrected and formula added by _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 07 2010
